questions.question: What are the two primary types of bees found in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Apis cerana and Trigona spp.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Apis cerana?
choices: Unable to adapt to various climates
Excellent foragers, flying up to 1-2 km from the hive
questions.answer: Excellent foragers, flying up to 1-2 km from the hive

questions.question: What is a traditional honey harvesting method in Timor-Leste?
choices: Climbing tall trees or cliffs to reach wild bee nests
questions.answer: Climbing tall trees or cliffs to reach wild bee nests

questions.question: Which crop, a major export of Timor-Leste, benefits significantly from bee pollination?
questions.answer: Coffee

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Trigona spp. (stingless bees) in Timor-Leste?
choices: They produce more honey than Apis species
They are larger than Apis cerana
They build nests only in underground cavities
Their honey has distinct flavor and medicinal properties
questions.answer: Their honey has distinct flavor and medicinal properties

questions.question: How has beekeeping in Timor-Leste evolved over time?
choices: It has remained unchanged for centuries
It has shifted from modern techniques to traditional methods
It has transitioned from traditional honey hunting to more modern beekeeping practices
It has completely abandoned all traditional methods
questions.answer: It has transitioned from traditional honey hunting to more modern beekeeping practices

questions.question: What material do Trigona spp. use to build their nests?
choices: A mixture of wax and plant resins (propolis)
questions.answer: A mixture of wax and plant resins (propolis)

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a challenge facing beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Overabundance of modern beekeeping equipment

questions.question: What is the term for plants that produce substances collected by bees to make honey?
questions.answer: Melliferous plants

questions.question: Why is the introduction of European honeybees (Apis mellifera) considered unsuccessful in Timor-Leste?
choices: They did not adapt well to the local climate and conditions
questions.answer: They did not adapt well to the local climate and conditions

questions.question: What is the primary economic benefit of beekeeping for rural communities in Timor-Leste?
choices: Export of bees to other countries
Production of honey, beeswax, and other bee products
questions.answer: Production of honey, beeswax, and other bee products

questions.question: How does climate change affect beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
choices: It has no impact on beekeeping
It only affects imported bee species
It alters flowering patterns and increases extreme weather events
questions.answer: It alters flowering patterns and increases extreme weather events

questions.question: What is the size range of Trigona spp. in Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is a characteristic of Apis cerana?
choices: Inability to adapt to different climates
Preference for building nests in open areas
questions.answer: Prone to absconding when disturbed

questions.question: What is the main difference between traditional honey hunting and modern beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
choices: Traditional methods use more advanced technology
Modern beekeeping focuses on wild bee colonies
Traditional hunting often destroys the entire colony
questions.answer: Traditional hunting often destroys the entire colony

questions.question: How do bees contribute to biodiversity in Timor-Leste?
choices: By controlling the population of other pollinators
questions.answer: By pollinating native plant species

questions.question: What is a potential advantage of focusing on native bee species for beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
choices: They produce more honey than non-native species
They are better adapted to local pests and diseases
They can pollinate a wider range of non-native crops
questions.answer: They are better adapted to local pests and diseases

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical nesting location for Trigona spp.?
questions.answer: Open tree branches

questions.question: What is the approximate size of Apis cerana compared to European honey bees?
questions.answer: Smaller

questions.question: Which of the following initiatives is NOT mentioned as being underway in Timor-Leste to support beekeeping?
choices: Creating bee-friendly landscapes using native plants
questions.answer: Introducing non-native bee species

questions.question: What is the primary method used to calm bees during traditional honey hunting in Timor-Leste?
choices: Using smoke from burning specific plants
questions.answer: Using smoke from burning specific plants

questions.question: How far can Apis cerana typically forage from their hive?
questions.answer: 1-2 kilometers

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the current state of beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
choices: A mix of traditional honey hunting and modern beekeeping practices
questions.answer: A mix of traditional honey hunting and modern beekeeping practices

questions.question: What is a key advantage of stingless bees (Trigona spp.) in crop pollination?
choices: They can pollinate crops with large flowers more effectively
They are active year-round regardless of weather
They can pollinate crops with small flowers effectively
questions.answer: They can pollinate crops with small flowers effectively

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a product of beekeeping in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Royal jelly

questions.question: What is the main challenge in transitioning from traditional honey hunting to modern beekeeping in rural areas of Timor-Leste?
choices: Limited availability of education and resources
questions.answer: Limited availability of education and resources

questions.question: How does beekeeping contribute to sustainable development in Timor-Leste?
choices: By providing a sustainable source of income for rural communities
By eliminating the need for crop pollination
By increasing the use of pesticides
questions.answer: By providing a sustainable source of income for rural communities

questions.question: What is the significance of integrating beekeeping into agroforestry systems in Timor-Leste?
choices: It reduces the need for crop rotation
It eliminates the need for chemical fertilizers
It enhances biodiversity and provides multiple benefits to farmers
questions.answer: It enhances biodiversity and provides multiple benefits to farmers

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Timorese honey?
choices: It is always clear and colorless
It has unique flavors influenced by diverse local flora
It is identical to European honey
It cannot be stored for long periods
questions.answer: It has unique flavors influenced by diverse local flora
